resources.string: Could not start magnetic field sensor
Make sure that the magnetic field sensors are not disturbed when using the augmented reality view. Shaking the device may reset the sensors.\n© 2013 52°North, visit http://52north.org/android

This development is supported by the European Commissions Seventh Framework Programme (FP7) via the project GeoViQua (QUAlity aware VIsualisation for the Global Earth Observation system of systems), grant number 265178.
Uses mapsforge - free mapping and navigation tools - API, see http://code.google.com/p/mapsforge/

More information at
http://52north.org/android 

GeoAR is part of the 52°North Geostatistics Community: 
http://52north.org/communities/geostatistics/
52°North GeoAR Augmented Reality Browser for Android

We are sorry, but GeoAR raised an unhandled exception during its last execution.
Fortunately, details on this error were recorded!
Please help us improving GeoAR by sending us an error report.
(This will open your E-Mail App)
I\'m very happy to help improving GeoAR!
You have not installed any DataSources at the moment. DataSources are essential for viewing data in GeoAR.\nIn order to install a DataSource, just follow the steps in this introduction.

Under the DataSource button you will find all the DataSources you have activated.\nAt the moment you got no DataSource installed. To install a DataSource, click on the highlighted DATA SOURCES button in the upper ActionBar.
Any installed and activated DataSource will be listed here.\n\nJust click on MORE... in order to come to the place where DataSouces were handled.
This area shows up two tabs with installed and downloadable DataSources.\n\nClick on the DOWNLOAD tab to get a list of DataSources you are able to download
Now its up to you to make a decision which DataSource you would like to install.
You have successfully downloaded a DataSource! In order to use these, they must be activated.\n\nGo back to the INSTALLED tab, where you will find your DataSource.

In this view all the downloaded DataSources are listed. These can be enabled and disabled upon your request.\n\nIn order to enable/disable a DataSource, click on the respective field or on the corresponding checkbox in the lower left of the field.
Your selected DataSource is activated. Go back to the Map View.
